title: Man Beat 2 Transgender Women Who Tried to Enter McDonald's, NYPD Says
text:
Man Beat 2 Transgender Women Who Tried to Enter McDonald's, NYPD Says By Katie Honan | March 18, 2017 1:54pm View Full Caption Maria Munoz 
JACKSON HEIGHTS â€” A Long Island man attacked two transgender women on Friday afternoon, shouting anti-gay slurs as he beat them outside a fast-food restaurant in what police have charged as a hate crime. 
Patrick O'Meara, 38, started yelling at the women as they tried to enter McDonald's on 82nd Street, near Roosevelt Avenue, around 4:30 p.m. Friday, according to police. 
He called the women "b--ches" and "f-ggots" and attacked them, pushing one woman to the ground and punching and kicking her, police said. 
He briefly left the scene and returned with a cane, hitting one of the victims in the left hand, which caused a laceration. 
Maria Munoz, who saw the attack, said O'Meara was shirtless and yelling at people on the street before he flew into a rage. 
"He was harassing everybody that was walking by but when the trans women walked by he clearly was infuriated," Munoz said. 
One of the victims was taken to Forest Hills Hospital, and the other was treated at the scene. 
O'Meara was arrested and charged with assault as a hate crime and was awaiting arraignment Saturday. 
In January, he drunkenly stole a Volvo in Manhattan and was charged with grand larceny auto and driving while intoxicated, police said. Officers found a glass crack pipe in his pocket when he was arrested. 
He also had at least five other arrests, but they were sealed, an NYPD spokeswoman said.
